author: Sharon Terlep
title: A Megadeal Joined Sharpie Markers and Crock-Pots. What Could Go Wrong? A Lot
text:
The $15 billion acquisition united household names such as Elmerâ€™s glue, Sharpie markers and Graco strollers with Rawlings baseball gloves, Crock-Pot cookers and Yankee Candles. The resulting consumer-products giant was supposed to have enough clout to squeeze rivals, dominate store shelves and move quickly into online sales.
Instead, the marriage of Newell Brands Inc. and Jarden Corp. has become a case study of the ways a megadeal can go bad.
